metadata.dc:title: From bonding pathology to the emotional instability disorder. How the child became an hedgehog
metadata.dc:description: Across the presentation of a case of Emotional Instability Disorder in a teen male attended in the day hospital for child and adolescent of Gran Canaria, there will be analyzed the importance of the early relations in the development of the personality. It will be a question of explaining to him how from diverse alterations in the attachment there are going to be generated different symptoms, which without any intervention, will crystallize in the paradigmatic symptoms of the Bordeline Personality Disorder that we all know. We will expose brief the used interventions and the difficulties found in the psichotherapy work of the presented patient (AU)

Almeida Díaz, Elena
